critique: The executive order appears to be a formal and legal document. It primarily aims to convey a sense of official action and continuation of service. It does not seem designed to evoke strong emotions in the audience. The most relevant emotion might be a mild sense of reassurance or stability, but even that is quite weak. Therefore, I will score joy, sadness, anger, fear, disgust, and surprise as very low initially. Upon further reflection, the document is unlikely to evoke any of these emotions. The revised scores will be even lower.
